item.title: Any precedents on Libel and Defamation Law for Bloggers in Ireland?
item.description: Mike Butcher has just published a very useful piece on how to protect yourself as a blogger if you write something that results in a libel action being mounted against you and your content. It is all based around “The Reynolds defense of Responsible Journalism”. Whilst it makes total sense to me as a lay-person, it clearly is only directly relevant to UK bloggers. Since it’s generally felt that Irish libel law is even more ridiculous than that of the UK, I wonder if there are any similar cases/precedents that apply here?
